channel.title: Templating logic on `glurmo` by example
channel.description: Recent content in Templating logic on `glurmo` by example

item.title: Setting up
item.description: Templating logic Suppose we decide that only one gigabyte of memory is pushing it for the simulations where N is set to 300. We could simply change the memory parameter to “2g”, but as discussed in the introduction, this might not be ideal. It would be nice if we could set all the settings where N is less than 300 to run with 1 gigabyte of RAM, and those where N is 300 (and eventually greater) to run with 2 gigabytes of RAM.

item.title: Running
item.description: Running the simulation For the sake of completeness, let’s run the simulation to make sure everything worked as expected: $ glurmo -r 5 . The results should be exactly the same as previous simulations, and you can find them in the same places.
